name: I am Bread
description: You are bread. Your mission, become toast! Take on all hazards to deliciousness as you head on an epic adventure in one of the the toughest games ever baked. All of the game modes (including Bagel Race) are now unlocked so there's sure to be something to suit everyone's taste!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 2.4 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTS 450 or better DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2500 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX9.0 compatible sound card Additional Notes: For best experience Xbox 360, Xbox One, PS4, OUYA, Logitech F310/F710, Speedlink Strike or NVIDIA Shield controller recommended

reviews.review_text: If you don't have a controller, don't bother. Totally infuriating. I mean, granted, it warns you about that as soon as you start it up, but make sure you heed that warning before you buy it.

2 Hours in, and WOW. This is amazing I cant belive Im this into this game. The Small details, the hidden methods of getting around, toasting. The occasional Physics bugs (which IMHO are a fantastic feature when making toast fly!) I love there are so many more modes than just go get toasted in the main story, this should keep me busy for a while and be super fun to stream!

Not a game for everyone, lets just get that out of the way. But I do suspect Dark Souls players, such as myself, are in the right mind-set to understand I Am Bread, and enjoy it. Once I got the right idea, it became addictive and, amazingly, rather meditative.  In terms of gameplay it's slow and takes loads precission and patience. If you're expecting run-and-gun instant satisfaction, look elsewhere, this is not a CoD generation experience. Make your way through a level at a snails pace, enjoying the journey, however, and victory is incredibly rewarding. Yes, the controls take getting used to, but it honestly didn't take as long as I thought to have my bread doing air-flips.  One major issue that can't be ignored; the camera is not your friend. And in a game requiring such concentration and precission, that can be a right pain in the ♥♥♥. (Likewise with Dark Souls.)  All in all, I tip my hat to the developers for originality, incredible detail, and amazing sound design. (The music gets repetitive quick, but the sound of physical objects is outstadning.)

This is more than just a joke game. This is a masterpiece well worth your time.  CONTROLS: First of all, personally I like the control system. For the main story mode hold down a button to select a bread corner, then move it in the direction you want it to go. Sure there is a short learning curve, but I find climbing and navigating the world with these kinds of control schemes very enjoyable. The gifs you will find posted by the master players on the community hub are a joy to behold. Don't be afraid. Give it a go!  If the controls still bother you there are plenty of game modes, (including a free roam mode) starring different characters who are mostly easier to control than a bread slice.  Gameplay: The variety is what makes this game stand out against most joke simulators. There is plenty to do, and the game isn't reliant on humour to succeed.  You can enjoy a Star Wars parody, you can hunt for cheese, you can race baguettes, and you can plate up the dirtiest piece of bread you have ever seen with a smile on your face after skateboarding through dust, ants and falling in the dish water.  This is a unique fun game that deserves a chance. Give it a go.

This was the first game I ever refunded.   This game is brutally punishing. You might find yourself 30 minutes into a stage only to slip up and find yourself all the way back at the beginning. I'd be okay with that if the gameplay was enjoyable, but it isn't. You're a piece of bread and you move around with the agility you'd expect of a piece of bread.   In many games like this, the bad controls add to the character or humor of the game. In Surgeon Simulator, for example, the failure is largely why the game is so much fun. But this is just bread. The humor doesn't last five minutes.   I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone.
I didn't have much fun playing with KB+mouse but once I plugged in the controller the game really shines.

I started the game I lost at the first I raged at the point where i almost destroy my entire pc I started to get the comands I ended Destroying a guy`s kitchen  Flying in a rocket while swinging a knife like a psycho all over the place All while being a perfectly beautyful piece of bread.  Why? Because i can  93428/10 Would glitch all over the place again What are u waiting for

I am Bread is not one of those silly 'LEL SIMULATOR!!!11 BUT NOT REALLY XDXD LEL PHYSICS :):):)' games. It is difficult, with odd controls, and it gives you very little to go on for how you get to the goal.  If you like challenging games, go ahead and buy it for full price, but if you're unsure wait for a sale. You'll probably have fun, but this game is not for everyone.

If you've ever wondered what would happen if you mashed QWOP and OctoDad together I Am Bread is it. You play a piece of bread on a quest to get toasted in each level, using various items such as irons or radiators or frying pans. Touching the floor or any other dirty surface will reduce your edibility percentage and once that hits 0% you lose.  Unfortunately, the game’s engine and programming also mean you will have to battle with the camera randomly adjusting itself on certain angles and the bread ragdolling around spastically from time to time. You can alleviate this to some degree by predicting which corner will contact next during a flip and hold that corner’s respective button down but even that can be a guessing game. Keeping in mind, your grip meter is counting down the entire time you are holding any buttons down so you’re on a time limit until you reach stable ground. After a few rounds of flailing and failure the game will throw you a bone by giving you an invincibility power up although using it basically removes any challenge from the game.  I Am Bread is one of those games where you either love the concept or hate it, and I couldn’t find anything to love about it. Maybe it’s just me, but I would rather spend time fighting bad guys than my own controller.
Was skimming through the store to find a bread game to play. I found that bread game.

Pros:  - Creative theme; - Insane gameplay; - Tons of fun!;  Cons:  - Somewhat pointless; - Some people may not find the game fun at all; - Confusing online mode.  Rating: 70/100 - Good chance to worth your money and time.  []'s,  cont3xt'

Wow is the word that describes how I felt about this game after I had a playthrough. Going in I really didnt expect much because I felt that there could not be much to do in the game. Boy was I wrong, this is a solid game. Its not just another surgeon sim or goat sim. There are lots of stuff to do with all the game modes and great enviroments. Its a tricky, tough game that doesnt ♥♥♥♥ you off when you mess up and go back to the beginning because its so fun I really didnt care. I played the first story mission for a little over an hour even when I had already beat it because I wanted to see other ways I could do to beat it. I am looking forward to sitting down again and putting a lot more time into it. You would have to be a flour tortilla not to like this game

I am bread is a delicious game. It takes some time and a lot of patience before your bread flinging abilities become toast-worthy, and if you can get past the initial learning curve then you're in for a jam covered treat. The story mode for this game is amusing to play through and the gameplay offers challenging puzzles and various gamemodes.  This is a well rounded game, fun for both killing time and spending days completing. My main comment would be to use a controller. Great game.

I went into this game expecting what everyone else was when they first saw this game. A physics based game like surgeon simulator, but a platformer. Surely this was headed towards amazing comedic effect and fun gameplay, right? well you're an idiot if you still think that after more than an hour of playing this processed horse urine. Not only does it control like a drunk clown trying to do a balancing act while sucking on a cats nipples, but it feels like walking through a pool of molasses and rusty nails. You could ram your head on the sidewalk outside of your house for an hour and get the same effect that this game would give you. I'm sick of people saying this game is funny, or fun in general. It looks like something a college freshman cooked up on unity with 20 minutes of work and a $3 budget. It makes me ashamed that I decided to play this trash, and i'm even more ashamed that i played all the game modes trying to find something good. Except bagel, Bagel knows whats up. but you cant even enjoy him because he only has like 6 levels; then it's back to the same awkward controls that give me a brain tumor. Maybe if you sat down and really tried to master this games controls while also ignoring the graphics that look like something a dog would throw up, but doing so would be cruel and unusual torture. This game makes me feel like hanging myself. the end

How often do you get to hear the sentence, 'The bread is fully released, it's ready for action'?  Yeah. Unique. Kind of like the game.  Frustrating, hard, funny, bread puns, and driving a man insane.  You are Bread.

I Am Bread is very simple. You play as a piece of bread. Either that or the creators are saying they are bread and you are the one turning them into to toast.  Anyways. The Objective is simple. Become Toast. However. Its not that easy. In the First Level. You start off on a table, You have 3 Items along with you. Jam, Butter, And Nuts. You are able to cover your self in these. Be careful with the butter though. or you will end up on the floor dead withen 5 seconds. (Yes. This game applys to the 5 second rule. you dont get off the floor. you'll die.) But Heres the hard part. The Toaster Is All the way on the other side. It gets more creative though in later levels. such as in the bathroom you use a hair dryer (Yes i said hair dryer) To become toast. Or... You could go down the toilet and fall apart.  There are other modes then the original concept of becoming bread and not having fun. Such as... Zero G, Bagel Race, Rampage, FreeRoam, Etc.   There are also modes you can unlock from beating story mode. Such as... Starch Wars Team Fortress 2 (MEDIC!) Goat Simulator (Ram-Page)  This game i highly recommend. If you think its bad. You just are bad at controls. The game is good.  9/10

Yet another 'hilariously' bad game that embraces its own awfulness. The challenge of the game lies solely in fighting the God-awful controls. That said, the concept behind the game is solid; you're a piece of bread trying to get from point A to point B while navigating the environment without touching the floor. It could have been a surprisingly fun title if the the develepor wasn't trying so hard to capture lightning in a bottle again as they did with the equally atrocious, and undeservedly popular, Surgeon Simulator 2013. I would seek a refund if I hadn't recieved my copy from a Humble Bundle. 1/10, don't waste your time with this title even if somebody offers you a free copy.

I'm sorry but this game is NOT worth the money, when I bought it I was very exicted and all it did was disappoint me and frustrate me if anyone knows a way for me to get a refund please tell me. I rate this game 4/10. Very sorry that I said this its just my opinion. ~Get_Out_Meh_Car

Fun game. Just don't expect to beat it on your first RYE. If you are good at the Attack on Titan Tribute Game, you should be quite TOASTY with the title, so long as your in the mood for something a bit more AGAINST THE GRAIN. But seriously, I guess I better get on with it and put the BUNS to BREAD.  For me, it wasn't that hard to play. People complain about the controls, but I have no problem flinging myself accross the room. My advice is to think a few steps ahead, and keep a cool head. The hardest part for me was figuring out the puzzles, which aren't too intensive (Definately not Portal levels of critical thought, only the last one before the epilog gave me pause.).  As for the story, it's basically summed up as bread tolling a conspiracy theorist who everyone thinks is crazy.  While the premise is simple, I actually wish Michel Bay would make a movie out of it. (Spoilers: You get to blow up a gas station! If that doesn't sell you on the game I don't know what will.) It would be such an absurd movie, but I think it would be a box-office hit!  It's a game for gamers. That is all.
i ♥♥♥♥♥♥ killed myself. RIP 4/5/15 The last words: ♥♥♥ my ♥♥♥♥♥♥ life. This game is a freaking retardo game and is a murder game. 11/10

I really, really, REEEEALLY wanted to love this game. I am very into quirky games, I pride myself in checking out all of the strangest, most oddball games on Steam. And I had heard great things about I Am Toast. But sadly, for me at least, this game is almost unplayable. Wacky concept with pretty nice graphics and a TERRIBLE control scheme. Maybe my brain doesn't work in the way it's supposed to for this control scheme to make sense. I even played it mostly with a PS3 gamepad, and I still could not get the hang of it for the life of me. Nothing but frustration. The grip meter depletes too quickly, so you barely have time to hang onto objects. Attempting to flip over the edge of ledges is a chore in redundancy and pain, as the moment you flop onto the ground you are basically dead. You get, what, like 5 seconds at most to find a surface to latch onto after falling to the ground? I'm sorry, but this is not challenging, it's just downright AGGRAVATING.  Just when I thought the controls couldn't get any worse, I attempted Zero G mode. HA!!! A true exercise in futility. Made absolutely no sense whatsoever to me as to how to accurately control the flying toast. Honestly, the controls could have been stellar if they were based more off of the scheme used in Katamari Damacy. Maybe I'm crazy uncoordinated here, but I just can't understand how so many people out there love this game and are able to get the hang of the controls. It's rare in this day and age for me to play a game that is so unique and has so much potential, only to be buried by horrific controls. I feel like it's been a solid 5-10 years since I've played a game with a control scheme as unbareable as this one. It's sad, really, because it simply destroys what I was hoping to be a fresh, original, exciting experience like the first time I played Katamari.

Great game! I've had a load of fun playing so far. No real surprise given their last game, 'surgeon simulator' was excellent as well. These guys have a knack for making fun, querky games that provide an interesting level of difficulty. The gameplay is inventive and you'll always be on the edge of your seat. One wrong move and there goes your level progress. This difficulty seems to add to the fun for me instead of making things frustrated. I am Bread is a bit more straight-foward compared to their last game as well since guiding your bread to a heat source to make toast is far less complicated than carefully cutting a fake person apart. One thing I will say is that if you want to play I am Bread for any length of time make sure you have a compatible controller. I downloaded the neccessary software to use my ps4 controller because my hand that controlled keyboard functions got cramped pretty fast playing. Every once in a while there is a bit of drop in framerate. I'm running a AMD 6100 6-core processor with a Radeon 6800 HD graphics card with 8GB of RAM, and I know for certain the game is having the problem. Just wait for it to catch up and then resume. I first became interested in these games after watching the guys from roosterteeth play both I am Bread and Surgeon Simulator. They should definately get thanked for their advertising of the games. I own both games. I play I am Bread here while I ussually play Sugeon simulator on PS4. Thanks guys for some fun games.

The controls are awkard and require some getting used to, as expected, the game wouldn't make sense otherwise. However, getting in the toaster is just plain ridiculous, even with a single 'large' opening. I don't know how many times I should have been in the toaster before it finally worked. It took me 40 minutes to complete the kitchen level and over half an hour was spent JUST trying to get in the toaster, it's really just plain ridiculous. This game could have been fun if all you needed to do was to go through obstacles ON THE WAY to the toaster, but the toaster just destroys this game. Sorry, wouldn't recommed it unless the developers made toasting reasonable.  PS: oh, it also crashes very easily.

If you ever wanted to put your gaming skills to a test and somehow twist your hand eye coordination part of your brain into a pretzel while atempting to do a simple task as toast yourself?Holy moly, this game is both insanely fun and frusterating! A very, very cute novelty game where the bad controls are fully intentional to make it challenging.  It is fully possible to beat this game with a low-mid skill set, but you won't be getting A-rank on any missions.  Gamepad support is inbuilt, and allows for both Xbox 360 Icons during Gamepad play as well as Ps1/Ps2/Ps3/Ps4 icons (my personal preference, before getting a gaming PC I was a Playstation gamer, and over 10 years of using one has buried the button locations so firmly in my mind that that's my default for gamepad and Xbox style baffles me (even though I have a Xbox gamepad because it is more compatible with PC games than a PS3 one).  Assorted updates have added silly (but fun) new gamemodes/maps such as Starch Wars (where you take down an ironing board star destroyer against bagel-shaped TIE fighters), TF2 (where you get to play as Heavy's Sandvich) and Goat (in collaboration with Goat Simulator, where you get to destroy the I am Bread worlds as a goat).  Also, it's a prequel to Surgeon Simulator.

This game is very unique, fun, and challenging! It's like the Goat Simulator of bread. If you enjoy Goat Simulator, or games where you can mess around in general, or just want to pass time, this is for you! This is one of the best gaming experiences I've ever been through. And what's better is you can free roam around the map after finishing it in the story!   I reccommend playing this game with an XBox 360/One or PS3/PS4 controller. I use the XBox 360 controller with this, and I cannot emphasize enough that it makes the gameplay a LOT more easy. The keyboard is very well useable for gameplay, but controllers are best IMO.  I really feel that this game is something that I could play for hours on end and not get bored. I just played it for 70 mins before deciding to write a review, and haven't found anything I don't like about it yet. The gameplay is very straight forward and easy to figure out. And if you're worried about forgetting controls - fear not! it displays the buttons you can press on the corners of the bread as you play.  I highly reccomend this game. Good job, Bossa.

This looked like a really fun, lighthearted game, but it ended up just being tedious. Moving around takes forever, and being so floppy makes where you land anyone's guess. I stopped playing after being unable to open the door handle in the second level and not seeing anything to cook me in the room.

and your goal, is to be Toast. You, a single slice, of soft white bread, wishes to adventure away from the loaf and find a source of heat. If you are strong, and wise, you will find a path that allows you to find your goal before being covered in filth. If one becomes covered by the darkness of sins that cover the lands between your home and your destination then you will become trapped and unable to continue your quest. Although, if you are able to travel the rough lands and find the holy lands of warmth, you must be able to perfectly bask in the warmth to allow yourself to become what you were born to be. . . TOAST. . . . Just don't burn yourself, no one likes to eat charcoal.

I do like that game companies are trying to make games that are more than just shooting as many enemies as possible, however this game is very frustrating. It is hard to move the bread in the direction you want it to go, and some times you will become toast, and then the game won't take you to the next level. Yet, this game can be fun. Watching a slice of bread fly across room can be entertaning, and the moments when you almost plumet to your death, but catch hold of something are heat-stopping. There are a few problems with 'I am bread,' but there are also many good things about this game. Overall, I would recommend playing I am bread in short game plays, and to people with lots of patience.  P.S Also, the therapy reports of the dude living in the house are hilarious XD

Seems like a neat game and I was very excited for it, but my controller just does not work with it... I really dislike the feel of the keyboard and mouse controls (it's very obvious that the game was made specifically for controller use), so it's not a very satisfying experience. I've tried several fixes but none have worked. I think I'll just get a refund. :(  I'm sure this game is very fun but be careful if you have any controller other than Xbox 360 or PS4, as those are the only officially supported ones (and even then there are several potential issues). Even if your controller works perfectly outside of I Am Bread and you've used it to play plenty of other games, there's a chance it won't work in this one. That's the main reason why I can't really recommend this game, because it's essentially unplayable for me (not literally, but I find the keyboard controls so frustrating that I can't enjoy it like this).
I am Impressed.
Fun to watch someone else play, not too much fun to play yourself.

Overall a decent game worth a try, however the abysmal 3rd person camera, inconsistent visual detail and iffy physics killed most of the enjoyment I felt I would get from this game.   I played SS previously and that was a pretty fun gem, yet it did have some quirks and an excessive amounts of clipping. Bread, I don't feel, is anywhere near as good as SS.   Bread's friendship with Goat Simulator sort of reduced my minimal respect for such an original game, that is Bread. GS is an extremely buggy game that thrives off of bugs, glitching and clipping, all are annoyances of mine. Labeling weak coding and QC as an aspect of gameplay doesn't cut it for me. I felt Bread went down that route a little bit, which I don't like.   Performace of Bread is questionable. I get huge frame rate drops when the Goat destruction levels start up and also every time I break that jar of jam with the bread. Speaking of the jam, the glass containers in this game look like something from a 2005 title. They are a huge eye sore, and they are everywhere. Technology exists today that makes glass look realistic... please use it. This is a 2015 title. Even with it being from a small developer, they still have enough money to get some decent looking glass going on. 21st Century Fox is a partial owner of Bossa, there's tons of money there to get some better graphics and coding. Hopefully they go down this route as Bossa becomes more popular. I hear they're working on a MMO open-world title right now... yikes. That's a huge jump.   Speaking of graphics, it's hit or miss in each level. The few levels towards the end are the worst, visually. It doesn't make sense why this is even happened other than laziness, or they ran out of time. The game has a gradual decline in graphics the further you progress. I see tons of low res textures, a very poor sky box, background visuals look like they're from the 80's, etc. Graphics aren't everything, but they are important.   Some visuals are cartoony, some are more heavily detailed.... don't mix this sh**, pick one and go with it for the whole game.  The third person camera... Christ. Yes, many games suffer from third person camera issues, especially those old GTA games, but lets get this sh** cleaned up, guys. It jumps around everywhere, clips through everything, hinders those bagel racing levels like crazy, and is poorly optimized. It pisses me off. Unity can do better.   Iffy physics. Props and movable objects sometimes do move around in a natural manner when you grab them or push them, but not all of the time. It's inconsistent, like the visuals. I've gotten stuck on props many times, and have had myself, and different objects bounce unnaturally in different directions, before saying to myself 'wtf is this sh**, seriously?'   Negatives aside, Bread does have its moments. I'm glad the 0 gravity mode is back from SS. It is very difficult to control, but is rewarding when you beat it. The humor is nice. The game is fun to watch. The concept is fresh. Like SS, the controls and movements have a steep learning curve, but is awesome when you get it down.   Like I said previously, maybe give the game a whirl, it's pretty unique. Like SS, it requires a lot of patience. As for the questionable overall quality, Bossa: talk to Fox and get some heavy funds rolling in, hire a few more devs (get some people from big triple-A companies), get some Unity pros to work with ya'll--Unity can accomplish so, so, so much more.   Thanks.
